oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Indiana Union soldier Clarles Ward
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Writing to his mother Ward, a British subject fighting in the 60th Ind. Vol. Inf. Regt., USA, describes "a hard fight" in which the Federals lost 1300 killed and wounded. "The rebels were too strong for us and they came pretty near capturing us before we got rein-forced." Speaks of "old general Smith" coming up "with bout ten thousand more men" to save the day for the Union side.
